programme.title: Mike Tyson's Greatest Hits
programme.desc: The career of the renowned heavyweight champion boxer is showcased, including highlights of his beginnings as an aspiring amateur, his WBC, WBA, IBF championship victories, and ringside footage from his greatest matches.

programme.desc: Evan Cohen, Chris Canty and Michelle Smallmon discuss the latest stories from around the world of sports making headlines, previewing some of the biggest games in the coming days, and guest interviews to gather their unique perspective.

programme.title: NBA Basketball
programme.desc: Milwaukee claimed victories over Philadelphia in their first two meetings of the season, winning the most recent matchup on Jan. 19 with a 123-109 scoreline; Giannis Antetokounmpo posted 34 points and 15 rebounds for the Bucks in the win at home.

programme.title: Blood, Sweat & Tears
programme.desc: An all-access look showcases the two boxers training camps as they prepare for their upcoming marquee bout, including the unique planning that goes into scouting their opponent and their background to show how they got to this point.

programme.title: In the Arena: Serena Williams
programme.desc: Growing up in Compton, Calif., Serena Williams rose to tennis stardom at an early age, winning her first Grand Slam championship at the age of 17 at the 1999 US Open over Martina Hingis and quickly jumping out of her older sister Venus' shadow.

programme.title: First Draft
programme.desc: ESPN experts Field Yates and Mel Kiper Jr. follow the NFL Draft throughout the year, breaking down the stock of players who have risen and fallen during the college football season, what each team needs to draft and the latest trade news.

programme.title: First Draft
programme.desc: ESPN experts Field Yates and Mel Kiper Jr. follow the NFL Draft throughout the year, breaking down the stock of players who have risen and fallen during the college football season, what each team needs to draft and the latest trade news.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: Hand games have become a staple of young Black girls dating back generations, as the documentary traces the history of the games and the influence they have had on pop culture and the creative landscape, including music, dance and style.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: A New York City DJ would change the culture of basketball in the late 1990s after putting music behind streetball highlights, creating the And1 Mixtape series to give a unique and entertaining perspective to a rarely-seen brand of basketball.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: Sean Pamphilon travels with Ricky Williams through his year out of football that he spent in Australia, giving away his adulation in the NFL and lucrative contract for a chance to find himself after rumors of a positive marijuana drug test spread.

programme.title: College Basketball Live
programme.desc: Game commentators provide a detailed look at all things pertaining to college basketball, including previews of upcoming games, analysis of game-changing moments, discussions on breaking news, highlights of top players and more.

programme.title: Women's College Basketball
programme.desc: Ole Miss claimed a 75-45 victory over Kentucky in their lone meeting from the 2023-24 season, led by 16 points and 6 assists from Madison Scott; Amiya Jenkins and Saniah Tyler both had 10 points for the Wildcats in the defeat at home.

programme.title: Abdullah Mason: Appetite for Smoke
programme.desc: One of the top up-and-coming lightweight boxers, Abdullah Mason uses an entertaining boxing style to start his career undefeated and pursuing more, bigger names as he looks to add a title to his accolades in becoming a household name.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Coverage of college basketball games.

programme.title: Top Rank Boxing on ESPN
programme.desc: Started in 1973 by Bob Arum and Jabir Herbert Muhammad, Top Rank Boxing showcases some of the biggest names in the sport as one of the premier promoters, as fighters move up the rankings in their weight classes to earn a title bout.

programme.title: SportsCenter Special
programme.desc: NFL insider Field Yates reveals his latest mock for the 2025 NFL Draft before the actual draft, going over who they think will be heading to each team, the players that are rising and falling, and the sleepers to sneak into the first round.

programme.title: Numbers on the Board
programme.desc: Four friends talk all things NBA basketball and provide their unique perspectives, breaking down results from the recent games, the latest news making headlines across the league and rumors making the rounds that could create waves.

programme.title: Wooden Award Late Season Top 20 Special
programme.desc: The 20 contenders still competing for the illustrious Wooden Award are revealed, showcasing highlights from some of their biggest performances of the season, along with statistical analysis to exemplify why they deserve the recognition.

programme.title: ESPN BET Live
programme.desc: Host and sports oddsmakers break down the latest betting action around sports, discussing some of the most recent lines on the marquee matchups and the upsets that bettors should be aware of before putting their money down on the game.

programme.title: UFC Archival PPV
programme.desc: Alex Pereira (9-2) defends his lightweight championship against Jamahal Hill (12-1) in the main event; Zhang Weili (24-3) defends her strawweight title against Yan Xiaonan (17-3); Justin Gaethje (26-4) defends his BMF title vs. Max Holloway (25-7).

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: Joining the list of memorable defense lines with even more memorable nicknames in NFL history, Mark Gastineau, Joe Klecko, Marty Lyons and Abdul Salaam formed one of the most dominant defensive lines in NFL history for the New York Jets in the 1980s.

programme.title: Breakfast Ball
programme.desc: Craig Carton, a newly inducted member of the New York State Broadcasters Hall of Fame, joins Chicago sports radio personality Danny Parkins and FOX NFL game analyst Mark Schlereth to discuss the most enticing stories in sports each weekday morning.

programme.title: First Things First
programme.desc: Media personalities offer their views and opinions on the day's most intriguing storylines across the world of sports, including debates on the latest issues, analysis of player performances, and discussions on game results and other news.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Xavier (14-9, 6-6) defeated the Wildcats, 69-63, on Jan. 14 behind 34 points and four assists from Ryan Conwell; Villanova (13-10, 6-6) is 10-3 at home this season behind Eric Dixon, who leads the country in scoring with 23.8 ppg.

programme.title: The Facility
programme.desc: Former football players break down the latest sports news making headlines across the country, giving a unique perspective from the athletes point of view on results of some of the recent marquee matchups and the stories impacting their league.

programme.desc: Teams compete in the 54-hole, season-opening event, as golfers play under the lights at night for a $25 million purse in the first-ever LIV Golf tournament held in Riyadh, Saudi Arabia; Jon Rahm (individual) and Ripper GC (team) won 2024 titles.

programme.title: Women's College Basketball
programme.desc: Michigan State claimed an 88-58 victory over Michigan in their first meeting of the season on Jan. 25, led by Theryn Hallock's 25 points and 4 assists; Jordan Hobbs posted 15 points and 5 rebounds for the Wolverines in the defeat at home.

programme.title: TMZ Sports

programme.title: A Perfect Storm: 1979 Daytona 500
programme.desc: The first 500-mile race to be televised live in its entirety on national television drew a captive audience after a snowstorm hit most of the Northeast; Cale Yarborough, Richard Petty, and Donnie Allison were part of an exciting and memorable finish.
